- âœ“ PDF viewer scroll-to-page and text highlight â€” v1.5

<!-- Shipped in v2.0 -->

- âœ“ Unified 5-node LangGraph pipeline (ingestâ†’extractâ†’parseâ†’groundâ†’persist) â€” v2.0
- âœ“ criteria_extracted outbox removed; single protocol_uploaded trigger â€” v2.0
- âœ“ PostgreSQL checkpointing with retry-from-checkpoint â€” v2.0
- âœ“ TerminologyRouter with entity-type-aware routing (YAML config) â€” v2.0
- âœ“ NLM direct API grounding (RxNorm, ICD-10, LOINC, HPO) â€” v2.0
- âœ“ UMLS/SNOMED via direct Python import (not MCP subprocess) â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Multi-code entity model (rxnorm_code, icd10_code, loinc_code, hpo_code) â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Two-model grounding: MedGemma reasons, Gemini structures output â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Three-pronged entity filtering for high CUI rate â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Grounding confidence >0% with diagnostic logging â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Audit trail visible per-criterion on Review page â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Dashboard pending count with criteria-level accuracy â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Review status colored borders (green/red/blue/yellow) â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Reject dialog with structured audit-ready reasons â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Criteria search/filter with 300ms debounce â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Section grouping (Inclusion/Exclusion/To Be Sorted) â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Field mapping badges in read mode â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Editor pre-loads saved field_mappings â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Multi-terminology badges (color-coded per system) â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Re-extraction without re-uploading PDF â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Batch archiving with fuzzy review inheritance â€” v2.0
- âœ“ temperature=0 for extraction determinism â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Corpus comparison: batch diff with fuzzy matching â€” v2.0
- âœ“ Agreement metrics with 3-layer progressive disclosure â€” v2.0
- âœ“ AI-powered criterion re-run via Gemini â€” v2.0

### Active

<!-- v2.1 E2E Testing & Quality Evaluation -->

- [ ] E2E pytest suite running real PDFs through Docker Compose pipeline
- [ ] Quality evaluation script with markdown report generation
- [ ] Bug/problem catalog from pipeline analysis

<!-- Paused: v1.1 Documentation -->

- [ ] Component deep dives for each service
- [ ] Data models and LangGraph state documentation
- [ ] Implementation status report
- [ ] Code tour walkthrough

### Out of Scope

- PII field-level encryption -- acceptable risk for pilot with no real patient data
- Real-time notifications -- not needed for small pilot
- Multi-tenant isolation -- single-team usage
- Event bus / Kafka -- direct service calls sufficient
- Mobile app -- web only
- FHIR EvidenceVariable export -- deferred to v3
- OMOP Circe integration -- deferred to v3
- Inter-annotator agreement (IAA) tracking -- deferred to v3
- Patient-level eligibility matching -- deferred to v3

## Context

**Brownfield codebase:** Fully functional system with 4 Python services (api-service, protocol-processor-service, extraction-service, grounding-service) and a React HITL UI. The protocol-processor-service is the primary pipeline path (v2.0); extraction-service and grounding-service are v1.x legacy.

**Architecture:**
- `api-service` â€” REST endpoints, persistence, outbox processor
- `protocol-processor-service` â€” Unified 5-node LangGraph pipeline (v2.0 primary path)
- `extraction-service` â€” v1.x criteria extraction (legacy, superseded by protocol-processor-service)
- `grounding-service` â€” v1.x UMLS grounding (legacy, superseded by protocol-processor-service)
- `shared` â€” SQLModel models, events, inference loaders

**AI Services:**
- Gemini API (google-genai SDK) â€” Structured criteria extraction from PDFs, JSON structuring, criterion re-run
- MedGemma on Vertex AI â€” Medical entity reasoning, terminology candidate evaluation
- NLM REST APIs â€” RxNorm (RxNav), ICD-10/LOINC (Clinical Tables), HPO (JAX ontology)
- UMLS/SNOMED â€” Direct Python imports from umls_mcp_server and grounding_service

**Target users:** Clinical researchers reviewing AI-extracted criteria for accuracy.

**Scale:** Small pilot, <50 protocols.

## Constraints

- **Tech stack**: FastAPI, SQLModel, LangGraph, React/Vite, TanStack Query, Radix UI
- **Database**: PostgreSQL with SQLModel ORM, LangGraph PostgresSaver checkpointing
- **PDF storage**: GCS bucket, store only URI in database
- **Auth**: Google OAuth
- **AI models**: Gemini via google-genai SDK, MedGemma via Vertex AI
- **Python tooling**: Always use `uv run` for Python commands (per CLAUDE.md)

## Key Decisions

| Decision | Rationale | Outcome |
|----------|-----------|---------|
| Adapt template services (not monolith) | Leverage existing service structure | âœ“ Good |
| GCS for PDF storage | Fits GCP ecosystem, avoids database bloat | âœ“ Good |
| SQLModel (not raw SQL) | Maintains Pydantic integration | âœ“ Good |
| Google OAuth | Fits GCP ecosystem, simple for pilot | âœ“ Good |
| Direct PDF multimodal extraction | Gemini natively understands PDFs; markdown conversion is lossy | âœ“ Good |
| Cauldron-style field mapping editor | Entity/relation/value triplets are industry standard | âœ“ Good |
| Unified 5-node LangGraph pipeline | Replaces 2 separate services + outbox hop; simpler, faster | âœ“ Good |
| NLM direct APIs over ToolUniverse | Free, no-auth, well-documented; ToolUniverse medical tool availability unconfirmed | âœ“ Good |
| Two-model architecture (MedGemma + Gemini) | MedGemma for medical reasoning, Gemini for reliable JSON structuring | âœ“ Good |
| Read-only AI criterion re-run | Gemini proposes, reviewer commits; no accidental DB writes | âœ“ Good |
| Batch archiving + fuzzy review inheritance | Preserves review work across re-extractions; rapidfuzz token_set_ratio | âœ“ Good |
| uuid4 thread_id per pipeline run | Prevents LangGraph checkpoint collision on re-extraction | âœ“ Good |
| temperature=0 for extraction | Deterministic output for corpus building; prompt granularity instructions | âœ“ Good |

# Clinical Trial Criteria Extraction System

**Progress:** [â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–‘] 22/23 plans (96%)
**Profile:** balanced

## Recent Work
- [Phase 44, Plan 03]: Grounding parallelization (asyncio.gather + semaphore) and orphan trace cleanup
- [Phase 43, Plan 01]: Backend archive endpoint, deduplicate query, protocol status change audit, frontend hooks

## Current Position
Phase 43 of 44: dashboard-protocol-list-ux
Plan 2 of 2: **unexecuted** (1 summary / 2 plans)
CONTEXT: âœ“

## Key Decisions Made
- pybreaker CircuitBreakerError wraps original exception on fail_max'th call
- Grounding parallelization: Semaphore(4) inside ground_node
- archive_protocol only accepts dead_letter/extraction_failed/grounding_failed states
- Deduplication uses MAX(created_at) subquery join + separate COUNT for version_count

## Blockers/Concerns
- E2E tests require real Gemini API (paid tier recommended)
- Docker Compose stack must be running for full pipeline testing

## Pending Todos
None.

---

**43-02: Frontend UI** â€” Activity feed component, dashboard wiring, protocol list dedup/archive actions, and dead letter retry buttons.

1â†’# Project State
     2â†’
     3â†’## Project Reference
     4â†’
     5â†’See: .planning/PROJECT.md (updated 2026-02-17)
     6â†’
     7â†’**Core value:** Clinical researchers can upload a protocol PDF and get accurately extracted, UMLS-grounded eligibility criteria that they can review and approve in a single workflow â€” replacing manual extraction that takes hours per protocol.
     8â†’
     9â†’**Current focus:** Phase 44 â€” Quality Report Fix & Traceability Cleanup (Complete)
    10â†’
    11â†’## Current Position
    12â†’
    13â†’Phase: 44 of 44 in current milestone
    14â†’Plan: 03 of 3 complete
    15â†’Status: Complete
    16â†’Last activity: 2026-02-18 â€” Phase 44 complete (criteria_text bug fix, unit tests, grounding parallelization, orphan trace cleanup)
    17â†’
    18â†’Progress: [â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ] Phase 44 Plan 03 of 3 complete
    19â†’
    20â†’## Performance Metrics
    21â†’
    22â†’**Overall Velocity:**
    23â†’- Total plans completed: 68 (through Phase 38-02)
    24â†’- Average duration: ~13 min
    25â†’- Total execution time: ~15.6 hours (across v1.0, v1.3, v1.4, v1.5, v2.0)
    26â†’
    27â†’**By Milestone:**
    28â†’
    29â†’| Milestone | Phases | Plans | Total Time | Status |
    30â†’|-----------|--------|-------|------------|--------|
    31â†’| v1.0 | 1-7 | 24 | ~3.6 hours | Shipped 2026-02-12 |
    32â†’| v1.1 | 8-10 | 6 | ~45 min | Paused |
    33â†’| v1.3 | 16 | 1 | ~7 min | Shipped 2026-02-12 |
    34â†’| v1.4 | 17-21 | 7 | ~2 hours | Shipped 2026-02-13 |
    35â†’| v1.5 | 22-28 | 11 | ~8 hours | Shipped 2026-02-13 |
    36â†’| v2.0 | 29-35 | 19 | ~2 hours | Shipped 2026-02-17 |
    37â†’| v2.1 | 36-39 | 5 | ~16 min | In progress |
    38â†’| Phase 39 P01 | 121s | 2 tasks | 1 files |
    39â†’| Phase 40 P02 | 3 | 2 tasks | 0 files |
    40â†’| Phase 42 P02 | 6 | 2 tasks | 5 files |
    41â†’| Phase 43 P01 | 8 | 3 tasks | 4 files |
    42â†’
    43â†’## Accumulated Context
    44â†’
    45â†’### Decisions
    46â†’
    47â†’Decisions are logged in PROJECT.md Key Decisions table.
    48â†’
    49â†’**v2.1 Roadmap (2026-02-17):**
    50â†’- Phase 36 â†’ 37 are the E2E pytest track (markers + fixtures first, then assertions + baseline)
    51â†’- Phase 38 â†’ 39 are the quality evaluation track (report script first, then bug catalog section)
    52â†’- Tracks run independently; execution order is 36 â†’ 37 then 38 â†’ 39 (or in parallel)
    53â†’- Quality script reads from existing DB output or triggers new pipeline runs on 2-3 PDFs from data/protocols/
    54â†’- E2E tests require Docker Compose running (real PostgreSQL + real Gemini API); skip marker when not available
    55â†’
    56â†’**v2.0 Key Decisions (2026-02-17):**
    57â†’- Two-model architecture: MedGemma for medical reasoning, Gemini for JSON structuring
    58â†’- uuid4 thread_id per pipeline run prevents checkpoint collision on re-extraction
    59â†’- NLM direct APIs (RxNorm/ICD-10/LOINC/HPO) over ToolUniverse â€” free, no-auth, well-documented
    60â†’- Read-only AI criterion re-run: Gemini proposes, reviewer commits via existing action endpoint
    61â†’- [Phase 39]: Bug Catalog placed after LLM Assessment; orphan detection skipped per plan constraints
    62â†’
    63â†’**Phase 40-01 Key Decisions (2026-02-17):**
    64â†’- All 6 terminology systems accessed via ToolUniverse SDK (single dependency, single pattern)
    65â†’- TTLCache(ttl=300) for autocomplete caching â€” 5-minute TTL appropriate for real-time use
    66â†’- Demographic entities routed to umls+snomed (NOT skipped); MedGemma handles derived mapping
    67â†’- Consent entities skipped before grounding â€” not groundable to medical terminology codes
    68â†’- MedGemma 3-question agentic reasoning loop in single prompt (minimize token usage)
    69â†’- Gemini collaborates on reasoning structuring via gemini_suggestion field
    70â†’- expert_review routing as reasoning string marker (not new field) â€” avoids schema change
    71â†’
    72â†’**Phase 40-02 Key Decisions (2026-02-17):**
    73â†’- Docker container is running stale pre-Phase-40 image; code verification done via direct uv run calls (correct approach)
    74â†’- 5/5 tested systems return real codes (ICD10, RxNorm, HPO, LOINC, UMLS) â€” all pass, plan required only 3
    75â†’- [Phase 40]: Docker container running stale pre-Phase-40 image; code verification done via direct uv run calls (correct approach)
    76â†’- [Phase 40]: 5/5 tested systems return real codes (ICD10, RxNorm, HPO, LOINC, UMLS) â€” all pass, plan required only 3
    77â†’
    78â†’**Phase 42-01 Key Decisions (2026-02-18):**
    79â†’- end_trace() inside finally is a no-op when span closes normally via context manager â€” safe to always call
    80â†’- MLFLOW_TRACE_TIMEOUT_SECONDS=300 is safety net only (process-kill), not primary fix (try/finally is primary)
    81â†’- Bind mount (../data/uploads:/app/uploads) over named volume â€” dev workflow benefits from browsable host directory
    82â†’- SHA-256 symlink deduplication preserves URI compatibility while saving disk space via .hash-index.json
    83â†’- [Phase 42]: tu_breaker uses fail_max=10 (not 3 like other breakers) â€” ToolUniverse wraps multiple APIs, higher tolerance appropriate
    84â†’- [Phase 42]: Decorator order: @tu_breaker (outer) + @retry (inner) â€” 3 retries count as 1 circuit failure, prevents premature circuit open
    85â†’- [Phase 42]: 503 for circuit-open, 502 for service error â€” frontend tracks these separately for amber indicator
    86â†’- [Phase 42]: Sentence extraction with preamble regex + 4-word fallback to reduce 422 errors from full eligibility criterion text submitted as search queries
    87â†’- [Phase 43]: archive_protocol only accepts dead_letter/extraction_failed/grounding_failed â€” returns 400 for all other states
    88â†’- [Phase 43]: Deduplication uses MAX(created_at) subquery join + separate COUNT subquery for version_count (two-pass approach)
    89â†’- [Phase 43]: old_status captured before protocol.status mutation so audit log records actual transition
    90â†’- [Phase 43]: useProtocolList queryKey includes deduplicate param to ensure cache isolation
    91â†’
    92â†’### Pending Todos
    93â†’
    94â†’None.
    95â†’
    96â†’### Blockers/Concerns
    97â†’
    98â†’**E2E Test Constraints:**
    99â†’- E2E tests require real Gemini API (paid tier recommended â€” free tier: 20 req/day for 2.5-flash)
   100â†’- Docker Compose stack must be running with PostgreSQL and all services up
   101â†’- Test PDFs in data/protocols/ are 90K-159K â€” Gemini multimodal ingestion should handle these without issue
   102â†’- Pipeline is the unified 5-node LangGraph in protocol-processor-service (NOT extraction-service/grounding-service legacy paths)
   103â†’
   104â†’**Quality Script Design Choice:**
   105â†’- Script can read from existing DB data (no new pipeline runs) or trigger fresh pipeline runs
   106â†’- Decision deferred to plan-phase: reading from DB is faster but requires prior pipeline runs; triggering is slower but self-contained
   107â†’
   108â†’**v2.1 Key Decisions (2026-02-17):**
   109â†’- Conservative regression baseline thresholds to avoid flaky E2E tests; tighten after stable runs
   110â†’- Relative imports in test modules since tests/ lacks __init__.py
   111â†’
   112â†’**Phase 44 Key Decisions (2026-02-18):**
   113â†’- pybreaker raises CircuitBreakerError on the fail_max'th call itself (wraps original exception), not after -- tests adjusted accordingly
   114â†’- Grounding parallelization: Semaphore(4) inside ground_node (not module-level) to bind to current event loop
   115â†’- Consent entities pre-processed synchronously before parallel section to avoid unnecessary semaphore slots
   116â†’- Orphan trace cleanup runs at module import time via _cleanup_orphan_traces() -- idempotent, non-fatal
   117â†’
   118â†’## Session Continuity
   119â†’
   120â†’Last session: 2026-02-18
   121â†’Last activity: 2026-02-18 â€” Phase 44 complete (3/3 plans: bug fixes, unit tests, grounding parallelization)
   122â†’Stopped at: Phase 44 complete â€” awaiting verification
   123â†’Resume file: None
   124â†’Next action: Phase verification (verify_phase_goal)
   125â†’

     2â†’phase: 43-dashboard-protocol-list-ux
     3â†’plan: 01
     4â†’subsystem: api
     5â†’tags: [fastapi, sqlalchemy, react-query, typescript, audit-log]

     8â†’requires:
     9â†’  - phase: 42-pipeline-stability-umls-resilience
    10â†’    provides: stable pipeline with AuditLog model in shared.models
    11â†’provides:
    12â†’  - "POST /protocols/{id}/archive endpoint (archivable from dead_letter/extraction_failed/grounding_failed)"
    13â†’  - "GET /protocols?deduplicate=true â€” one row per title with version_count"
    14â†’  - "error_reason and version_count fields on ProtocolResponse"
    15â†’  - "protocol_status_change AuditLog entries emitted by persist_node on pending_review and grounding_failed"
    16â†’  - "useArchiveProtocol hook (POST /protocols/{id}/archive, invalidates protocols cache)"
    17â†’  - "useProtocolList accepts deduplicate?: boolean param"
    18â†’  - "Protocol interface has version_count?: number field"
    19â†’  - "useAuditLog has staleTime: 30_000"
    20â†’affects: [43-02-dashboard-protocol-list-ux-ui]
    21â†’
    22â†’# Tech tracking
    23â†’tech-stack:
    24â†’  added: []
    25â†’  patterns:
    26â†’    - "SQLAlchemy subquery-join pattern for deduplication with version_count"
    27â†’    - "AuditLog(event_type='protocol_status_change') emitted at state transition sites"
    28â†’    - "Optional version_count param on _protocol_to_response() helper"
    29â†’
    30â†’key-files:
    31â†’  created: []
    32â†’  modified:
    33â†’    - "services/api-service/src/api_service/protocols.py"
    34â†’    - "services/protocol-processor-service/src/protocol_processor/nodes/persist.py"
    35â†’    - "apps/hitl-ui/src/hooks/useProtocols.ts"
    36â†’    - "apps/hitl-ui/src/hooks/useReviews.ts"
    37â†’
    38â†’key-decisions:
    39â†’  - "archive_protocol only accepts dead_letter/extraction_failed/grounding_failed â€” returns 400 for all other states"
    40â†’  - "Deduplication uses MAX(created_at) subquery join + separate COUNT subquery for version_count (two-pass approach)"
    41â†’  - "old_status captured before protocol.status mutation so audit log records the actual transition"
    42â†’  - "useProtocolList queryKey includes deduplicate param to ensure cache isolation between deduplicated and non-deduplicated calls"
    43â†’
    44â†’patterns-established:
    45â†’  - "Protocol deduplication: subquery join pattern â€” select Protocol where (title, created_at) IN latest-per-title subquery"
    46â†’  - "version_count lookup: separate COUNT subquery fetched once, then looked up by title string key"
    47â†’  - "AuditLog emitted at status transition sites (not at pipeline level) â€” granular event sourcing"
    48â†’
    49â†’requirements-completed: [FIX-B7, FIX-B6, FIX-B8]
    50â†’
    51â†’# Metrics
    52â†’duration: 8min
    53â†’completed: 2026-02-18
    54â†’---
    55â†’
    56â†’# Phase 43 Plan 01: Dashboard Protocol List UX â€” Backend + Hooks Summary
    57â†’
    58â†’**Archive endpoint, protocol deduplication with version_count, persist_node audit logs, and useArchiveProtocol hook backing the dashboard activity feed and dead-letter archive UX**
    59â†’
    60â†’## Performance
    61â†’
    62â†’- **Duration:** 8 min
    63â†’- **Started:** 2026-02-18T15:16:55Z
    64â†’- **Completed:** 2026-02-18T15:25:00Z
    65â†’- **Tasks:** 3
    66â†’- **Files modified:** 4
    67â†’
    68â†’## Accomplishments
    69â†’- Added `POST /protocols/{id}/archive` endpoint (validates archivable states, returns updated ProtocolResponse)
    70â†’- Extended `GET /protocols` with `deduplicate=true` query param using SQLAlchemy subquery-join pattern; returns one protocol per title with accurate `version_count`
    71â†’- Added `error_reason` and `version_count` fields to `ProtocolResponse`; updated `_protocol_to_response()` helper to accept optional `version_count`
    72â†’- `persist_node` now emits `AuditLog(event_type="protocol_status_change")` for both `pending_review` and `grounding_failed` transitions, capturing old/new status and protocol title
    73â†’- `useArchiveProtocol` hook added to `useProtocols.ts`; `useProtocolList` updated to accept and pass `deduplicate?: boolean`; `Protocol` interface extended with `version_count?: number`
    74â†’- Added `staleTime: 30_000` to `useAuditLog` to prevent excessive refetching on dashboard renders
    75â†’
    76â†’## Task Commits
    77â†’
    78â†’Each task was committed atomically:
    79â†’
    80â†’1. **Task 1: Backend â€” archive endpoint, deduplicate query param, ProtocolResponse updates** - `9c5288d` (feat)
    81â†’2. **Task 2: Backend â€” protocol_status_change audit log in persist_node** - `2fd1a73` (feat)
    82â†’3. **Task 3: Frontend hooks â€” useArchiveProtocol, useProtocolList with deduplicate, Protocol interface** - `e19d191` (feat)
    83â†’
    84â†’## Files Created/Modified
    85â†’- `services/api-service/src/api_service/protocols.py` â€” archive endpoint, deduplicate param, _list_protocols_deduplicated helper, updated ProtocolResponse + _protocol_to_response
    86â†’- `services/protocol-processor-service/src/protocol_processor/nodes/persist.py` â€” AuditLog import + protocol_status_change entry in _update_batch_and_protocol
    87â†’- `apps/hitl-ui/src/hooks/useProtocols.ts` â€” version_count on Protocol, deduplicate on useProtocolList, useArchiveProtocol hook
    88â†’- `apps/hitl-ui/src/hooks/useReviews.ts` â€” staleTime: 30_000 on useAuditLog
    89â†’
    90â†’## Decisions Made
    91â†’- `archive_protocol` validates against `{"dead_letter", "extraction_failed", "grounding_failed"}` â€” returns 400 for any other state. Mirrors `retry_protocol` structure exactly.
    92â†’- Two-subquery pattern for deduplication: first subquery finds MAX(created_at) per title (excluding archived), second subquery counts versions per title. Both queries run once; version_count is looked up by title key after paginated results are fetched.
    93â†’- `old_status` is captured as `protocol.status` before any mutation so the audit log records the actual pre-transition state.
    94â†’- `useProtocolList` queryKey includes `deduplicate` to prevent stale cache hits when switching between deduplicated and non-deduplicated views.
    95â†’
    96â†’## Deviations from Plan
    97â†’
    98â†’None - plan executed exactly as written.
    99â†’
   100â†’## Issues Encountered
   101â†’- Pre-existing mypy errors across protocol-processor-service (import-untyped for shared.resilience, cachetools, tooluniverse, etc.) were confirmed pre-existing via git stash verification. No new errors introduced.
   102â†’- Pre-existing ruff E501 violations in ground.py, parse.py, trigger.py, and one line in persist.py (line 307 â€” outside my edit range) confirmed pre-existing. Zero new lint errors from my changes.
   103â†’
   104â†’## User Setup Required
   105â†’None - no external service configuration required.
   106â†’
   107â†’## Next Phase Readiness
   108â†’- All backend contracts ready for Plan 02 (frontend UI components)
   109â†’- `useArchiveProtocol`, `useProtocolList(deduplicate=true)`, and `useAuditLog` hooks available for dashboard wiring
   110â†’- Archive endpoint tested structurally (lint + type check pass); integration test requires running DB
   111â†’
   112â†’---
   113â†’*Phase: 43-dashboard-protocol-list-ux*
   114â†’*Completed: 2026-02-18*
   115â†’

1â†’# Summary Template
     2â†’
     3â†’Template for `.planning/phases/XX-name/{phase}-{plan}-SUMMARY.md` - phase completion documentation.
     4â†’
     5â†’---
     6â†’
     7â†’## File Template
     8â†’
     9â†’```markdown
    10â†’---
    11â†’phase: XX-name
    12â†’plan: YY
    13â†’subsystem: [primary category: auth, payments, ui, api, database, infra, testing, etc.]
    14â†’tags: [searchable tech: jwt, stripe, react, postgres, prisma]
    15â†’
    16â†’# Dependency graph
    17â†’requires:
    18â†’  - phase: [prior phase this depends on]
    19â†’    provides: [what that phase built that this uses]
    20â†’provides:
    21â†’  - [bullet list of what this phase built/delivered]
    22â†’affects: [list of phase names or keywords that will need this context]
    23â†’
    24â†’# Tech tracking
    25â†’tech-stack:
    26â†’  added: [libraries/tools added in this phase]
    27â†’  patterns: [architectural/code patterns established]
    28â†’
    29â†’key-files:
    30â†’  created: [important files created]
    31â†’  modified: [important files modified]
    32â†’
    33â†’key-decisions:
    34â†’  - "Decision 1"
    35â†’  - "Decision 2"
    36â†’
    37â†’patterns-established:
    38â†’  - "Pattern 1: description"
    39â†’  - "Pattern 2: description"
    40â†’
    41â†’requirements-completed: []  # REQUIRED â€” Copy ALL requirement IDs from this plan's `requirements` frontmatter field.
    42â†’
    43â†’# Metrics
    44â†’duration: Xmin
    45â†’completed: YYYY-MM-DD
    46â†’---
    47â†’
    48â†’# Phase [X]: [Name] Summary
    49â†’
    50â†’**[Substantive one-liner describing outcome - NOT "phase complete" or "implementation finished"]**
    51â†’
    52â†’## Performance
    53â†’
    54â†’- **Duration:** [time] (e.g., 23 min, 1h 15m)
    55â†’- **Started:** [ISO timestamp]
    56â†’- **Completed:** [ISO timestamp]
    57â†’- **Tasks:** [count completed]
    58â†’- **Files modified:** [count]
    59â†’
    60â†’## Accomplishments
    61â†’- [Most important outcome]
    62â†’- [Second key accomplishment]
    63â†’- [Third if applicable]
    64â†’
    65â†’## Task Commits
    66â†’
    67â†’Each task was committed atomically:
    68â†’
    69â†’1. **Task 1: [task name]** - `abc123f` (feat/fix/test/refactor)
    70â†’2. **Task 2: [task name]** - `def456g` (feat/fix/test/refactor)
    71â†’3. **Task 3: [task name]** - `hij789k` (feat/fix/test/refactor)
    72â†’
    73â†’**Plan metadata:** `lmn012o` (docs: complete plan)
    74â†’
    75â†’_Note: TDD tasks may have multiple commits (test â†’ feat â†’ refactor)_
    76â†’
    77â†’## Files Created/Modified
    78â†’- `path/to/file.ts` - What it does
    79â†’- `path/to/another.ts` - What it does
    80â†’
    81â†’## Decisions Made
    82â†’[Key decisions with brief rationale, or "None - followed plan as specified"]
    83â†’
    84â†’## Deviations from Plan
    85â†’
    86â†’[If no deviations: "None - plan executed exactly as written"]
    87â†’
    88â†’[If deviations occurred:]
    89â†’
    90â†’### Auto-fixed Issues
    91â†’
    92â†’**1. [Rule X - Category] Brief description**
    93â†’- **Found during:** Task [N] ([task name])
    94â†’- **Issue:** [What was wrong]
    95â†’- **Fix:** [What was done]
    96â†’- **Files modified:** [file paths]
    97â†’- **Verification:** [How it was verified]
    98â†’- **Committed in:** [hash] (part of task commit)
    99â†’
   100â†’[... repeat for each auto-fix ...]
   101â†’
   102â†’---
   103â†’
   104â†’**Total deviations:** [N] auto-fixed ([breakdown by rule])
   105â†’**Impact on plan:** [Brief assessment - e.g., "All auto-fixes necessary for correctness/security. No scope creep."]
   106â†’
   107â†’## Issues Encountered
   108â†’[Problems and how they were resolved, or "None"]
   109â†’
   110â†’[Note: "Deviations from Plan" documents unplanned work that was handled automatically via deviation rules. "Issues Encountered" documents problems during planned work that required problem-solving.]
   111â†’
   112â†’## User Setup Required
   113â†’
   114â†’[If USER-SETUP.md was generated:]
   115â†’**External services require manual configuration.** See [{phase}-USER-SETUP.md](./{phase}-USER-SETUP.md) for:
   116â†’- Environment variables to add
   117â†’- Dashboard configuration steps
   118â†’- Verification commands
   119â†’
   120â†’[If no USER-SETUP.md:]
   121â†’None - no external service configuration required.
   122â†’
   123â†’## Next Phase Readiness
   124â†’[What's ready for next phase]
   125â†’[Any blockers or concerns]
   126â†’
   127â†’---
   128â†’*Phase: XX-name*
   129â†’*Completed: [date]*
   130â†’```
   131â†’
   132â†’<frontmatter_guidance>
   133â†’**Purpose:** Enable automatic context assembly via dependency graph. Frontmatter makes summary metadata machine-readable so plan-phase can scan all summaries quickly and select relevant ones based on dependencies.
   134â†’
   135â†’**Fast scanning:** Frontmatter is first ~25 lines, cheap to scan across all summaries without reading full content.
   136â†’
   137â†’**Dependency graph:** `requires`/`provides`/`affects` create explicit links between phases, enabling transitive closure for context selection.
   138â†’
   139â†’**Subsystem:** Primary categorization (auth, payments, ui, api, database, infra, testing) for detecting related phases.
   140â†’
   141â†’**Tags:** Searchable technical keywords (libraries, frameworks, tools) for tech stack awareness.
   142â†’
   143â†’**Key-files:** Important files for @context references in PLAN.md.
   144â†’
   145â†’**Patterns:** Established conventions future phases should maintain.
   146â†’
   147â†’**Population:** Frontmatter is populated during summary creation in execute-plan.md. See `<step name="create_summary">` for field-by-field guidance.
   148â†’</frontmatter_guidance>
   149â†’
   150â†’<one_liner_rules>
   151â†’The one-liner MUST be substantive:
   152â†’
   153â†’**Good:**
   154â†’- "JWT auth with refresh rotation using jose library"
   155â†’- "Prisma schema with User, Session, and Product models"
   156â†’- "Dashboard with real-time metrics via Server-Sent Events"
   157â†’
   158â†’**Bad:**
   159â†’- "Phase complete"
   160â†’- "Authentication implemented"
   161â†’- "Foundation finished"
   162â†’- "All tasks done"
   163â†’
   164â†’The one-liner should tell someone what actually shipped.
   165â†’</one_liner_rules>
   166â†’
   167â†’<example>
   168â†’```markdown
   169â†’# Phase 1: Foundation Summary
   170â†’
   171â†’**JWT auth with refresh rotation using jose library, Prisma User model, and protected API middleware**
   172â†’
   173â†’## Performance
   174â†’
   175â†’- **Duration:** 28 min
   176â†’- **Started:** 2025-01-15T14:22:10Z
   177â†’- **Completed:** 2025-01-15T14:50:33Z
   178â†’- **Tasks:** 5
   179â†’- **Files modified:** 8
   180â†’
   181â†’## Accomplishments
   182â†’- User model with email/password auth
   183â†’- Login/logout endpoints with httpOnly JWT cookies
   184â†’- Protected route middleware checking token validity
   185â†’- Refresh token rotation on each request
   186â†’
   187â†’## Files Created/Modified
   188â†’- `prisma/schema.prisma` - User and Session models
   189â†’- `src/app/api/auth/login/route.ts` - Login endpoint
   190â†’- `src/app/api/auth/logout/route.ts` - Logout endpoint
   191â†’- `src/middleware.ts` - Protected route checks
   192â†’- `src/lib/auth.ts` - JWT helpers using jose
   193â†’
   194â†’## Decisions Made
   195â†’- Used jose instead of jsonwebtoken (ESM-native, Edge-compatible)
   196â†’- 15-min access tokens with 7-day refresh tokens
   197â†’- Storing refresh tokens in database for revocation capability
   198â†’
   199â†’## Deviations from Plan
   200â†’
   201â†’### Auto-fixed Issues
   202â†’
   203â†’**1. [Rule 2 - Missing Critical] Added password hashing with bcrypt**
   204â†’- **Found during:** Task 2 (Login endpoint implementation)
   205â†’- **Issue:** Plan didn't specify password hashing - storing plaintext would be critical security flaw
   206â†’- **Fix:** Added bcrypt hashing on registration, comparison on login with salt rounds 10
   207â†’- **Files modified:** src/app/api/auth/login/route.ts, src/lib/auth.ts
   208â†’- **Verification:** Password hash test passes, plaintext never stored
   209â†’- **Committed in:** abc123f (Task 2 commit)
   210â†’
   211â†’**2. [Rule 3 - Blocking] Installed missing jose dependency**
   212â†’- **Found during:** Task 4 (JWT token generation)
   213â†’- **Issue:** jose package not in package.json, import failing
   214â†’- **Fix:** Ran `npm install jose`
   215â†’- **Files modified:** package.json, package-lock.json
   216â†’- **Verification:** Import succeeds, build passes
   217â†’- **Committed in:** def456g (Task 4 commit)
   218â†’
   219â†’---
   220â†’
   221â†’**Total deviations:** 2 auto-fixed (1 missing critical, 1 blocking)
   222â†’**Impact on plan:** Both auto-fixes essential for security and functionality. No scope creep.
   223â†’
   224â†’## Issues Encountered
   225â†’- jsonwebtoken CommonJS import failed in Edge runtime - switched to jose (planned library change, worked as expected)
   226â†’
   227â†’## Next Phase Readiness
   228â†’- Auth foundation complete, ready for feature development

input.content:
---
phase: 43-dashboard-protocol-list-ux
plan: 02
subsystem: ui
tags: [react, typescript, lucide-react, radix-ui, react-query, audit-log, dashboard]

# Dependency graph
requires:
  - phase: 43-dashboard-protocol-list-ux
    plan: 01
    provides: "useArchiveProtocol hook, useProtocolList with deduplicate param, useAuditLog with staleTime, Protocol.version_count field"
provides:
  - "ActivityFeed.tsx â€” live audit log feed on dashboard consuming useAuditLog(1,20)"
  - "Dashboard.tsx wired with <ActivityFeed /> inside Recent Activity DashboardCard"
  - "ProtocolList.tsx dedup mode: deduplicate=!showArchived passed to useProtocolList"
  - "ProtocolList.tsx version badge: v{N} shown when version_count > 1"
  - "ProtocolList.tsx dead letter row tint: red-50/50 bg + border-l-2 border-l-red-400 for dead_letter/extraction_failed/grounding_failed"
  - "RetryInlineButton and ArchiveInlineButton inline in actionable rows"
  - "Archive confirmation dialog via @radix-ui/react-alert-dialog"
  - "Show Archived toggle chip alongside status filter chips"
affects: []

# Tech tracking
tech-stack:
  added: []
  patterns:
    - "ActivityFeed: formatRelativeTime + getEventIcon + formatAction pattern for audit log entries"
    - "isActionable computed per-row to gate red tint + inline action buttons"
    - "e.stopPropagation() on button clicks + outer td onClick to prevent row navigation"
    - "AlertDialog.Root wrapping Archive button for confirmation UX"

key-files:
  created:
    - "apps/hitl-ui/src/features/dashboard/ActivityFeed.tsx"
  modified:
    - "apps/hitl-ui/src/screens/Dashboard.tsx"
    - "apps/hitl-ui/src/screens/ProtocolList.tsx"

key-decisions:
  - "formatRelativeTime copied locally into ActivityFeed (not imported from ProtocolList) to avoid coupling between unrelated screens"
  - "deduplicateMode always-on (no user toggle); deduplicate param = !showArchived so archived view is verbatim"
  - "isActionable gates both visual styling and action buttons â€” single source of truth per row"
  - "Auto-advance checkpoint: Task 3 human-verify auto-approved (workflow.auto_advance=true)"

patterns-established:
  - "ActivityFeed pattern: useAuditLog â†’ loading/error/empty/list states with icon + description + relative time"
  - "Inline action buttons in table rows: stopPropagation on button + outer td for belt-and-suspenders nav guard"

requirements-completed: [FIX-B7, FIX-B6, FIX-B8]

# Metrics
duration: 10min
completed: 2026-02-19
---

# Phase 43 Plan 02: Dashboard Protocol List UX â€” Frontend Summary

**ActivityFeed component on dashboard with live audit log entries, ProtocolList dedup mode with version badges, and dead-letter row tint with Retry/Archive inline actions using @radix-ui/react-alert-dialog confirmation**

## Performance

- **Duration:** 10 min
- **Started:** 2026-02-19T08:48:10Z
- **Completed:** 2026-02-19T08:58:00Z
- **Tasks:** 3 (2 auto + 1 checkpoint:human-verify auto-approved)
- **Files modified:** 3

## Accomplishments
- Created `ActivityFeed.tsx` consuming `useAuditLog(1, 20)` with event-type icons (`GitCommit`, `CheckCircle`, `XCircle`, `Edit2`), relative timestamps, click navigation to `/protocols/{id}` or `/reviews`, and loading/error/empty states
- Replaced static "No recent activity" placeholder in `Dashboard.tsx` with `<ActivityFeed />` inside the Recent Activity DashboardCard
- Updated `ProtocolList.tsx` with: dedup mode always-on (`deduplicate=!showArchived`), version badge (`v{N}`) for `version_count > 1`, red-tinted rows and inline Retry/Archive buttons for `dead_letter`/`extraction_failed`/`grounding_failed` statuses, and "Show Archived" toggle chip

## Task Commits

Each task was committed atomically:

1. **Task 1: Create ActivityFeed.tsx and wire into Dashboard.tsx** - `9e4c43a` (feat)
2. **Task 2: ProtocolList.tsx â€” dedup mode, version badge, dead letter row styling, Retry/Archive inline buttons, Show Archived filter chip** - `9aa2d27` (feat)
3. **Task 3: Verify all three UX fixes work end-to-end** - Auto-approved (checkpoint:human-verify, auto_advance=true)

## Files Created/Modified
- `apps/hitl-ui/src/features/dashboard/ActivityFeed.tsx` â€” New component: audit log feed with icons, formatRelativeTime, formatAction, getEventIcon, click navigation
- `apps/hitl-ui/src/screens/Dashboard.tsx` â€” Added ActivityFeed import + replaced static placeholder with `<ActivityFeed />`
- `apps/hitl-ui/src/screens/ProtocolList.tsx` â€” Added showArchived state, dedup param pass-through, version badge, isActionable red row tint, RetryInlineButton, ArchiveInlineButton with AlertDialog

## Decisions Made
- `formatRelativeTime` is duplicated locally in `ActivityFeed.tsx` rather than imported from `ProtocolList.tsx` to avoid coupling between two unrelated screen-level files. Both implementations are identical.
- Deduplicate mode is always-on (`const [deduplicateMode] = useState(true)`); the `deduplicate` query param is controlled via `!showArchived` â€” archived view sees verbatim (undeduped) results.
- `isActionable` is computed once per row and used for both `<tr>` className and action button visibility, keeping the logic in one place.
- Task 3 checkpoint:human-verify was auto-approved per `workflow.auto_advance=true` configuration.

## Deviations from Plan

None - plan executed exactly as written.

## Issues Encountered
- Both Task 1 and Task 2 were already implemented and committed in prior sessions. Self-check verified all artifacts exist with correct content, TypeScript compile passes cleanly with zero errors.

## User Setup Required
None - no external service configuration required.

## Next Phase Readiness
- All three UX fixes (FIX-B7, FIX-B6, FIX-B8) are implemented end-to-end
- Dashboard activity feed, protocol dedup with version badges, and dead-letter inline actions are ready for browser verification when the stack is running
- Phase 43 complete â€” no follow-on phases blocked

---
*Phase: 43-dashboard-protocol-list-ux*
*Completed: 2026-02-19*

115â†’**Phase 44 Key Decisions (2026-02-18):**
   116â†’- pybreaker raises CircuitBreakerError on the fail_max'th call itself (wraps original exception), not after -- tests adjusted accordingly
   117â†’- Grounding parallelization: Semaphore(4) inside ground_node (not module-level) to bind to current event loop
   118â†’- Consent entities pre-processed synchronously before parallel section to avoid unnecessary semaphore slots
   119â†’- Orphan trace cleanup runs at module import time via _cleanup_orphan_traces() -- idempotent, non-fatal
   120â†’
